summary_promot:
You are given an image and related metadata and context.

            Metadata:
            - Document Title: Foothills Walkthrough
            - Section Title: Rhino Watch Slope
            - Sub-Section Title: Yaoguai Chief - Lang-Baw-Baw

            Context:
            - Preceding Text: "# Foothills Walkthrough

This will include Hound, Jackal, and Eagle Soldiers, as well as the tougher looker variants with shields called Captain of the Court.

As you get closer to the first Keeper's Shrine of the area, you'll see a large group of soldiers appear. Clear these out and then you can activate the shrine.

Be sure to check the Shrine Shop while you're here, and revisit the Zodiac Village to see what new items everyone has to offer.

Mount Huaguo Shrine Shop
| Mount Huaguo Shrine Shop            | Mount Huaguo Shrine Shop              | Mount Huaguo Shrine Shop            | Mount Huaguo Shrine Shop       |
| ----------------------------------- | ------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------- | ------------------------------ |
| Body-Cooling Powder (x6) - 180 Will | Shock-Quelling Powder (x6) - 180 Will | Tonifying Decoction (x3) - 360 Will |                                |
| Mind Core (x6) - 3000 Will          | Find Gold Thread (x2) - 3000 Will     | Celestial Ribbon (x1) - 9000 Will   | Gold Tree Core (x1) - 4500 Wil |


Now drop down from the Feng-Tail General and activate the nearby Keeper's Shrine. You'll see a field straight in front of you that's strewn with soldiers and fire. Before you head here, let's go find the second optional Poison Chief miniboss that's nearby.

## Rhino Watch Slope

In the midst of the trees, there's a small patch of ground with no grass. The Poison Chief can be found here.


Thankfully, each of the Poison Chief fights is pretty much the same. You can expect the same moveset and should prepare for them in the same way.

When the second Poison Chief is down, return to the Rhino Watch Slope and then head into the area with the flames on the ground. A cutscene will play out as you get there, and the Gold Armored Rhino will appear.


When you get to the edge, look down to see a muddy clearing. Down here, you can find the next optional boss, which is the final frog Lang-Baw-Baw.

### Yaoguai Chief - Lang-Baw-Baw

When you first drop in on Lang-Baw-Baw, a load of soldiers will also appear. You can ignore these and let Lang-Baw-Baw tackle them; they make for a good distraction so you can focus on hitting the frog while it attacks the soldiers."
            - Following Text: "When it comes to the one-to-one with Lang-Baw-Baw, you can expect to see the same type of moves that the previous frog bosses have used (if you've taken them all down so far). Expect to see it use its tongue as a whip to try and hit you, which you can dodge and dash away from. It will also leap up and try to belly flop you, as well as use its back kicks to quickly lash out when you're behind it."

            Your task:
            1. Generate a **short, clear, and informative English summary** of the image.
            2. Focus primarily on the **preceding and following text** to infer the image's **purpose, content, or narrative role**.
            3. Incorporate any relevant metadata (e.g., section or document titles) to improve coherence, **but do not assume any domain-specific knowledge** unless explicitly stated.
            4. Do **not** speculate beyond the visible content.



            Output Format:
            Preceding Text Summary:
            Provide a concise summary of the preceding text that gives context to the image.
            Image Summary:
            Provide a summary of the image, describing its purpose and content based on the context.
            Following Text Summary:
            Provide a concise summary of the following text that elaborates on the information related to the image.
img_summary:
Preceding Text Summary:
The preceding text describes the progression of the walkthrough in the "Foothills" area, specifically at the Rhino Watch Slope. Players encounter various enemies, including soldiers and minibosses like the Poison Chief. After defeating the second Poison Chief, players are directed to a muddy clearing where they face an optional boss, the Yaoguai Chief named Lang-Baw-Baw. The text highlights that soldiers will appear alongside Lang-Baw-Baw, serving as distractions during the encounter.

Image Summary:
The image depicts a player character facing off against Lang-Baw-Baw, a large red frog-like boss, in a rocky and muddy clearing. The frog is mid-attack, extending its tongue toward the player, showcasing one of its signature moves. The environment is dimly lit, with rugged terrain and surrounding cliffs, emphasizing the isolated nature of the boss fight.

Following Text Summary:
The following text provides details on Lang-Baw-Baw's moveset during the one-on-one phase of the fight. The boss uses its tongue as a whip, leaps to belly flop, and performs quick back kicks when the player is behind it. These moves are similar to those used by previous frog bosses, offering players familiarity in strategy and preparation for this encounter.
